t: Amazon.com | Hayabusa Pro Boxing Shoes for Men & Women | Fitness & Cross-Training
s: I didn’t have high expectations ... because Hayabusa boxing gloves to me are over-designed and over-engineered. However, these boxing shoes are really nice. They are quite comfortable; there is a little gel pad in the heel and they are not too narrow. The sole is good for pivoting and lateral movement. I wouldn’t call them “feathery light”—they are much heavier than an ASICS wrestling shoe—but for boxing they are fine. Sizing is definitely big. I wear a 11.5 or 12 in all brands of athletic ...

t: Amazon.com : Hayabusa S4 PU Leather Boxing Gloves for Men, Women & Kids, 10oz, 12oz, 14oz, 16oz, Training, Sparring, Kickboxing, Fighting Sports, Taekwondo, MMA, Muay Thai & Arts : Sports & Outdoors
s: Before I used this, my hands were in pain after a 1 hour session, and now the gloves feel perfect, not too tight, or too loose. If you break these gloves in properly, they will feel amazing. Hayabusa is a great, reputable brand with solid products, and I would definitely buy these again.
